<RESUME_START>
PUBLIC INFORMATION MANAGER, SR
Highlights
Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access; Knowledge of Mac and PC.
Professional: Strong written and verbal skills; project management skills; detail oriented team player; research skills.

EXPERIENCE

Public Information Manager, Sr
July 2006
to
Current
Company Name
Responsible for media relations for the City's Department of Watershed Management (DWM) to proactively ensure timely and accurate coverage including developing press releases, media alerts, and traffic advisories; provide talking points and briefings for DWM Commissioner and Deputy Commissioners for media interviews; monitor and track media coverage for accuracy, analysis and identification of potential issues; crisis communication resolution; generate updates for the Department's Atlantawatershed.org website and DWM's social media pages to provide continuous information to impacted stakeholders.
Provide daily media updates to the Mayor's Office of Communications to develop strategies to manage news coverage.
Develop and implement communications plans for DWM drinking water and wastewater construction and green infrastructure projects to include comprehensive public relations and outreach efforts to ensure effective citizen notification and involvement.
Past and present projects include: Peoplestown Flooding Response (Southeast Atlanta Green Infrastructure Initiative, including communications outreach for the construction of award-winning five-million gallon stormwater storage vault at Turner Field and first major permeable pavers project in the City of Atlanta); Green Stormwater Infrastructure Task Force; FEMA Floodplain Maps; Automated Meter Reading program; Georgia Tech-Midtown Water Main Replacement Project; Camp Creek Sewer Capacity Relief Project, and citywide Valves and Hydrants Assessment and Location Project.
Manage the public outreach activities for the Sewer System Evaluation Survey (SSES) and Sewer Rehabilitation Program and provide management and direction for a team of contract Public Information Managers and Public Information Officers.
Write articles for highlighting Watershed Management initiatives in industry trade publications, including Georgia Engineer.
Plan and execute press and special events related to construction projects, community activities and vendor/contractor.
Graduate of the City of Atlanta's.
Senior Manager
January 2010
to
January 2011
Company Name

Contributing writer for Airport's monthly on-line newsletter, HJN News.
Managed Department of Aviation's Speakers Bureau and assisted in the coordination of Hartsfield-Jackson Airport press events and managed on-site media.
Senior Public Relations and Information Specialist
May 2000
to

Developed presentations and created press materials including press releases, fact sheets, newspaper commentaries and pitch letters.
Coordinated and managed Speakers Bureau.
Developed and participated in community outreach campaigns.
Monitored and reported legislative activities during the Georgia General Assemblies.
Media relations responsibilities including monitoring media coverage of Department and other transportation related issues.
Worked closely with media to answer inquiries and meet media needs in an accurate, timely and professional manner.
Served as on — call , emergency Department spokesperson.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Account Executive, Public Relations

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Public Relations

Description:
Role Summary:The Senior Account Executive that has a focus on media relations will independently lead $100-299K in retainer accounts or projects. The Senior Account Executive will manage multiple responsibilities including generating consistent media exposure for clients, supporting the development of key themes, campaign strategy, client relations and mentoring other members of the team. Financial experience in public relations is a must have for success in this role.
Responsibilities:Media Relations:Identifies and secures an array of media placements including high-profile and feature opportunities for clients across the teamDelegates tasks and helps with mentoring Account Coordinators, Account Executives, and interns Assists in the development of strategic PR plans and campaign development for team accounts they supportDevelops and maintains relationships with all media outlets including trades, broadcast, and national mediaDevelops unique story angles and timely pitches to generate consistent client exposureClient Service:Independently leads $100-299K in client account revenueServe as lead point of contact and run calls for the client accounts they are leadingDraft PR plans for the accounts they are leadingFunctions as a general point of contact (for clients and internally) for PR initiativesSupports the lead point of contact for other team client accountsParticipates in regular client update calls and meetings as well as new client discovery meetings for other team client accountsWriting:Reviews and edits company-generated content before sharing with clientsSupports in drafting press releases, award nominations, social media posts, and other client-related materials, when neededAdministrative Support:Assists internal team members with other clients, business development, and Company projectsReviews press reports before sending to clientsEnsures that the team has saved final versions to SharePoint and has scheduled press releases for distributionCompany Ambassador:Acts as a steward of the JConnelly brand, consistently representing and reflecting the Company’s core values, approach, and high standards of excellence in all client, media, and public interactions
Performs other duties as assigned
Education: College degree; or equivalent related business experience
Experience & Expertise:Minimum 3-5 years of successful industry-related experience with an emphasis on managing client relationshipsDemonstrated ability to organize/prioritize work, handle details accurately, follow up with minimum supervision, and complete tasks within specified deadlinesExcellent interpersonal, communication, problem-solving, and customer service skillsProficiency with various software applications including the full Office suite, as well as social media channelsProficiency in PR related software including but not limited to Cision, Meltwater, TrendKite, Sprout, Hootsuite, etc.Experience in financial aspects of public relations is required for this role.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
